setup.question: Generally, which of the following best describes Brian's character?

Text.text:
Brian is a researcher for a corporation colonizing Venus, and the story follows him as he becomes involved with a rebel group against the corp.

When speaking to his assistant, as he leaves, his assistant makes a snide remark, and Brian

. He's clearly oblivious to his assistant's words. More ev if needed

Towards the end, when the rebels' base has been found, the Venusian police try to enter the base but are blasted with the rockets of a ship Brian and his rebel friend are in. When his friend begins freaking out,
Persistent: This is our character introduction to Brian:

He is incredibly dedicated to the tasks put in front of him and keeps persevering through any task put in front of him. He is also a bit of a door mat, letting his assistant just leave the task at hand. This is emblematic of his meekness.

Meek: Later on in the story, he gets in some trouble with the police. He tries to stand up for himself but folds when the police chief interrogates him. I can supply the quotes for this.
Both debaters seem to have more evidence to submit, would like to see some clash i.e. B proving why Brian isn't oblivious, etc.

B's usage of their first 2 quotes are extrapolation, it makes way more sense to say that his lack of understanding of his assistants is oblivious and based on his practical mindset. 

On meekness: When hearing the knocking of the police on his door, this is how he acts:
He then encounters a woman in his room who shouldn't be there, and this is his reaction:
His reaction is the total opposite of meek. Also on folding to the police chief, this is because Brain doesn't care about the woman at that point.
A mistakes obliviousness for not caring. At the beginning,

. He cares more about the work than socializing with his assistant about some woman he met. This demonstrates persistence because even when he should be off work, he is still invested in it.

B takes the meek quote out of context:
When a cop shows up to his door to investigate the female rebel, he tries to stand up for himself:
He stutters, falls over his words, lets himself get cut off, etc. He is a meek person.

I buy A's arg that B's evidence doesn't show persistence, it shows obliviousness. Also, A's evidence on Brian's reaction shows he is NOT meek - that combined with B's lackluster evidence about the girl makes me vote A (he could just be an incel whos bad w women).
Both debaters provide quality evidence for their side

Ideally i would have extended it, i think that A does a food job through quotes illlustrating thier point. Also, B's quotes about stuttering don't show meekness, he still stands up to the cop and maybe he is lying to protect her

answers.reason for outcome: A pointed out that one of B's evidence actually favored A.
I messed up my first piece of evidence for persistence.
Quality of evidence, also the interpretation and context I provided
I would have extended the debate longer, but A seemed to have more ev so i went with A
